basics.name: Allen Gooch
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Senior software engineer with systems programming, applications development, and technology leadership experience over full lifecycle of large-scale distributed systems, massively-multiplayer client-server and peer-to-peer online games.

work.summary: Software engineer responsible for development of full-stack solutions in TV analytics space.
highlights: React/Redux single-page application development.
Spark batch analytics systems development.
Kafka streaming analytics systems development.
Python web services development.
Containerized microservices development and deployment in Kubernetes clusters.
Deployments in terms of Infrastructure as Code with Terraform.
AWS cloud operations.

work.summary: Software engineer responsible for maintenance and continued evolution of Wizard of Oz Slots, a social casino slots game for Facebook, iOS, Android and Kindle.
highlights: Implemented various features for increased user engagement and retention.
Migrated server hosting to Amazon Web Services S3.

work.summary: Software engineer responsible for server infrastructure for 'Star Wars: The Old Republic', a massively-multiplayer online role-playing game.
highlights: Ported MMO engine and supporting technologies used by MMO game services from 32-bit Windows platform to 64-bit Linux platform.
Developed system for collection and real-time querying of metrics exported by game services for debugging and analytics use.
Developed system for configuration, provisioning, and control of game services and hosts.

work.summary: Lead software engineer responsible for online multiplayer for cancelled Xbox 360 and PS3 console game.
highlights: Implemented prototypes with design and art disciplines to create fun and rewarding console multiplayer experiences.
Created schedules, tasking for multiplayer engineering team.
Assisted Blacksite: Area 51 team with user interface, matchmaking, TCR/TRC, and Xbox Live programming tasks.

work.summary: Lead network engineer responsible for online multiplayer aspects of PSP product under development.
highlights: Evolved a legacy C code base to a more flexible C++ one capable of supporting maintenance and enhancement of primary product line at a much greater rate of delivery.
Performed migration from Visual Source Safe to Perforce and provided Perforce support to product development team.
Integrated JIRA with Perforce solution for full traceability of repository changes to issues necessitating the change.

work.summary: Lead network engineer responsible for development of proprietary networking services and infrastructure, and integration with external casino network service infrastructure.
highlights: Defined and installed networking infrastructure/services to support development and testing in new engineering division, including installation and administration of firewalls, hardware and software VPNs, intranets, defect tracking solution, and configuration management solution in heterogeneous multi-site Linux/Windows Server 2003 environment.
Developed lightweight, portable C++ component library providing dynamically loadable components on MS-DOS(!), Windows, and Linux platforms.

Evolved a proprietary networking middleware system to provide dynamic service discovery and provisioning enabling all single points of failure to be removed from primary casino services product, and enabling highly-availability and self-healing casino gaming service network topologies.
Developed casino cashless gaming system and integrated with multiple third-party cashless gaming web services.
Developed continuous integration tools in Python to enable automatic builds, deployment and test plan execution of primary casino gaming clients and services product.
Developed software processes, coding standards, roles, activities, and methodologies used by division.

work.summary: Contract programmer for a three-tier Java J2EE commercial product suite of applications used by many top graduate business schools for all aspects of participation from admissions to alumni.
highlights: Developed graduate business school career development system with JBoss, Spring, Hibernate and Microsoft SQL Server.
Developed reusable Java web components for web presentation layer in graduate business school product suite.

work.summary: Server engineer responsible for various pieces of server software infrastructure for EA.com and The Sims Online (TSO), a massively-multiplayer online game (MMOG).
highlights: After acquisition of Kesmai continued to develop online game middlware product for use within EA.
Development of user stream encryption system for custom middleware product providing significant risk-reduction of network attacks.
Development of enhanced user authorization system for middleware product.
Development of metrics collection system for middleware product
Development of continuous integration tools in Python to enable automatic builds, deployment and test plan execution of middleware product C++ and Java APIs and services.
Development of TSO server systems in terms of middleware product
Integration of TSO server systems with Electronic Arts authentication/authorization systems.

work.summary: Server programmer responsible for online game and middleware development.
highlights: Development of game server systems for Air Warrior II, an online multiplayer World War II combat flight simulator.
Development of online game middleware product providing C++ and Java APIs and service runtimes for MMOG applications.
Member of Software Process Improvement initiative responsible for defining and measuring the software development and peer review processes.
